content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a function such that <math alttext="f of 3, is less than 4, which is less than, f of 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn><mo><</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements provides sufficient additional information to conclude that there is a value <math alttext="x equals c " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 3 comma 5, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> such that <math alttext="f of c, equals 4 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is defined for all <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is increasing for all <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous for all <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

There is a value <math alttext="x equals c " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 3 comma 5, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> such that <math alttext="the limit as x approaches c, of, f of x, equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>â†’</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous for all <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 1.16: Working with the Intermediate Value Theorem (IVT)

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
